desc: Type of cancer with which the patient has been diagnosed (e.g. invasive ductal carcinoma, invasive lobular carcinoma, LSCC, LUAD) but diagnosis method unspecified
label: tumor_code

desc: Unique patient identifier
label: case_id

desc: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]
label: gender

desc: Patient's age at time of study
label: age

desc: The height of the patient, often measured in centimeters.
label: height_in_cm

desc: The weight of the patient, often measured in kilograms.
label: weight_in_kg

desc: Patient's body mass index
label: BMI

desc: Text for reporting information about race based on the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) categories.
label: race

desc: Text term that describes the anatomic site of the tumor or disease.
label: tumor_site

desc: Text term for the structural pattern of cancer cells used to define a microscopic diagnosis.
label: histologic_type

desc: Value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness. Generally expressed in the following classifications: High, Intermediate, Low, N/A; G1 (well differentiated), G2 (moderately differentiated), G3 (poorly differentiated), GX (grade cannot be assessed); I, II, III, IV, --; 1, 2, 3, 4, Not Available
label: histologic_grade

desc: The extent of a cancer, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body based on AJCC staging criteria and determined by pathology. Generally 0-IV, may also include A/B/C and is an aggregate of the TNM stages
label: tumor_stage_pathological

desc: The version or edition of the American Joint Committee on Cancer Staging Handbooks, a publication by the group formed for the purpose of developing a system of staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications, that was used to stage the patient's cancer.
label: AJCC_or_TNM_cancer_staging_edition

desc: Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). T followed by X, is, 0-4.
label: pathologic_staging_primary_tumor_pT

desc: Codes that represent the stage of cancer based on the nodes present (N stage) according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. N followed by X or 0-3
label: pathologic_staging_regional_lymph_nodes_pN

desc: Extent of the distant metastasis for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.
label: clinical_staging_distant_metastasis_cM

desc: Code to represent the defined absence or presence of distant spread or metastases (M) to locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes, using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).
label: pathologic_staging_distant_metastasis_pM

desc: Whether the patient is dead or alive at 12 month follow-up
label: vital_status_at_12months_follow_up

desc: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection. Often described by (R) classification: RX, no data/cannot be assessed; R0, no residual tumor; R1, microscopic residual tumor; R2, macroscopic residual tumor. Residual tumor may be found in the area of primary tumor and its regional lymph nodes and/or at distant sites.
label: residual_tumor

desc: Identifier for a biological specimen
label: specimens__specimen_id

desc: Type of specimen sample (e.g. blood, tumor, "normal")
label: specimens__tissue_type

desc: The largest dimension of the tumor at diagnosis.
label: tumor_size_in_cm

desc: The patient's alcohol use (e.g. Lifelong non-drinker; Consumed alcohol in the past, but currently a non-drinker; Alcohol consumption equal to or less than 2 drinks per day for men and 1 drink or less per day for women; Alcohol consumption more than 2 drinks per day for men and more than 1 drink per day for women; Alcohol consumption history not available; <10 drinks per week = light; 10-20 drinks per week = Moderate; >20 drinks per week = heavy; ex-drinker, non-drinker, unknown; no, social, significant)
label: alcohol_consumption

desc: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.
label: tobacco_smoking_history

desc: Date and time the data was added
label: inserted

desc: Date and time the data was updated
label: updated

desc: Number of days from the date of diagnosis or beginning of the study to the 12 month follow-up or death
label: days_from_initial_diagnosis_to_last_contact_at_12months_follow_up

desc: Whether the patient had a tumor, was tumor-free, or tumor status unknown at 12 month follow-up
label: tumor_status_at_12months_follow_up

desc: Identifier for a slide holding a sample of a specimen
label: specimens__slide_id

desc: Percentage of the specimen's surface area that is tumor
label: specimens__percent_tumor_surface_area

desc: Percentage of the specimen that is the tumor nuclei
label: specimens__percent_tumor_nuclei

desc: Percentage of the specimen's surface area that is necrotic
label: specimens__percent_necrotic_surface_area

desc: Weight of tissue specimen (often in mg)
label: specimens__weight_in_mg

desc: Whether the patient is dead or alive at 24 month follow-up
label: vital_status_at_24months_follow_up

desc: Numeric computed value to represent lifetime tobacco exposure defined as number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked divided by 20.
label: number_of_pack_years_smoked

desc: Number of years that men consumed more than 2 drinks per day or women consumed more than 1 drink per day
label: number_of_years_consumed_more_than_2_drinks_per_day_for_men_or_more_than_1_for_women

desc: Number of days from the date of diagnosis or beginning of the study to the 24 month follow-up or death
label: days_from_initial_diagnosis_to_last_contact_at_24months_follow_up

desc: Whether the patient had a tumor, was tumor-free, or tumor status unknown at 24 month follow-up
label: tumor_status_at_24months_follow_up

desc: Text terms to capture the cause of death for a patient.
label: cause_of_death_at_12months_follow_up

desc: Text to describe a tumor's histologic subtype or mixed diagnosis that is different from previously specified options.
label: histologic_type_other

desc: Whether the patient is dead or alive at 36 month follow-up
label: vital_status_at_36months_follow_up

desc: Number of days from the date of diagnosis or beginning of the study to the 36 month follow-up or death
label: days_from_initial_diagnosis_to_last_contact_at_36months_follow_up

desc: Whether the patient had a tumor, was tumor-free, or tumor status unknown at 36 month follow-up
label: tumor_status_at_36months_follow_up

desc: Text terms to capture the cause of death for a patient.
label: cause_of_death_at_24months_follow_up

desc: Text term for reporting information about ethnicity based on the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) categories.
label: ethnicity

desc: Text term that describes the anatomic site of the tumor or disease.
label: tumor_site_other

desc: Yes/no indicating if the patient has had a locoregional recurrence of the tumor by the 12 month follow-up
label: locoregional_recurrence_tumor_at_12months_follow_up

desc: Time interval from a person's date of death to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.
label: days_from_initial_pathologic_diagnosis_to_death_at_12months_follow_up

desc: Time interval from a person's date of death to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.
label: days_from_initial_pathologic_diagnosis_to_death_at_24months_follow_up

desc: Type of specimen sample (e.g. blood, tumor, "normal")
label: discovery_study

desc: Yes/no indicating if the patient has had a locoregional recurrence of the tumor by the 24 month follow-up
label: locoregional_recurrence_tumor_at_24months_follow_up
